captions.text: From the guy who came “Straight Outta Compton”
and ended up in “Are We There Yet?”

Comes the most popular black Friday besides
Black Friday
Before the release of Ride Along,

lace up your Chucks for another mid-90's classic
you can’t stop quoting...
"My neck! My back! My neck and my back!"
that has no actual plot whatsoever...

Experience a movie without a single guy person
in the cast.
It’s kinda like a reverse Lord of the Rings.
When he’s fired for stealing from work
And his friend Smokey gets caught

They’ll make things right by stealing money
this guy stole from someone else...

It’s kinda Robin Hood if he stole from the
poor and gave to a guy named “Big Worm”

Experience a film that’s like a Spike Lee
joint but with fewer morals
Prepare to learn more practical lessons, like:

Watch Ice Cube pave the way for Ludacris,
50 Cent, and LL Cool J as the first good rapper
"Anyway... what you doing up so early?"

And watch Chris Tucker in the role that launched
him into Rush Hour stardom..,

Seriously what the hell happened to Chris
Tucker?

Get ready to laugh at a film that would be
super offensive if it were

"I wanna eat some of them chitlin. I love
pig feet!"
"Man you know I want some Kool-Aid!"

But you don’t have to be from the hood to
love Friday, because this comedy speaks the
"Hey! Smokey back here takin' a sh*t!"

"Take a look at that paper over there on the
counter."

And not the terrible sequels. Seriously, those
are like, Madea bad...

Yo, I love it when they gave an ice cube to
Ice Cube so you could watch Ice Cube pick

Hey ScreenJunkies fans, before we’re bored
to death by award season, tell us what Oscar-winning

movie you’d like to see an Honest Trailer
of next.
And while you're at it, please subscribe.
